1.content:
Cathy walked home from school, ruminating in a funk about her bad day at school. She was a super hero yet had to deal with stuff like finals and her swimsuit dissolving in the water during practice. Her brother had given her the swimsuit, which she thought was unusually kind of him. She did tend to run through things like that inordinately fast, so she thought he had decided to be nice for once. It turns out it was a prank swimsuit that simply melted away. In front of Derrick.

She had just tried to start thinking about finals when she heard screaming in the neighborhood, several streets over. She froze. She couldn't simply run there; she needed to don her disguise, or her identity may become known. Yet there was little privacy to be had to change into her suit, and she wasn't impossibly fast like Superman.

Thinking she could go back for it later, she kept running.

Cathy was already embarrassed that she had lost her skirt and was running away in her panties. What made it worse was that a few people had seen her so far. The only good thing about that is that they were so busy running for their lives, they weren’t too focused on her.

She found an alley and went behind a dumpster to change. She quickly took off her shoes, socks, and shirt. Just as she was about to get her costume out of her backpack, a large shadow was cast on her. She looked up and saw a car, about to fall on her. She moved out of the way in time, but the car had landed on the clothes she had just taken off and her backpack. Now she was standing in just her underwear. Cathy would have used her strength to lift up the car and get her things back, but then she saw a large crowd of scared people running towards her. She had no choice but to run or else she would have been trampled. "Damn monster!," she thought.

Now half naked and running alongside a crowd of fully dressed people, not to mention the monster terrorizing the city, Cathy wondered if things could get any worse.

1111.content:
The terrorised group of people were too busy fleeing for their lives to notice the half-naked girl ducking down a narrow side alley.

Cathy could just about squeeze into the gap between the two buildings. Her bra scraped against the rough brick wall with every breath she took, while the one behind pinched and pulled at her panties whenever she leant against it. She waited there for a few moments before peeking her head out into the alley. Empty. The people were gone. With a sigh of relief, Cathy slipped out.

As the distant cries of the city reached her ears, she knew that she had to act fast. But down here, amongst the regular people, there was simply too much to distract her. Using her powers she flew off the ground and headed onto the roof of the nearest building.

Rough gravel crunched beneath her bare feet as she landed upon it. Apart from a TV aerial and a stairway into the building there was nothing up here.

"Perfect." she told herself.

She had lost more than enough clothing for one day, so rather cleverly (or so she told herself), she unhooked her bra and, clutching her bare breasts with one hand, hooked them onto the TV aerial. It sagged ever so slightly, but held. She slipped her thumb into the waist of her panties and pulled them down her legs, daintily stepping out of them and placing them alongside the bra.

"This way if I have an accident with my suit I can always come back here for these."

Reluctantly she removed her hand from her breasts and reached up to her shoulder. She touched bare flesh. She tried the other shoulder.

"Where the hell is my backpack?" she demanded.

She crept towards the edge of the roof and looked down onto the alley she had been hiding in. There was no sign of it there.

"Oh of course!" she said, slapping herself in the head "It's buried under the car with the rest of my clothes!"

Just then...

12.content:
Biting her lip, Cathy looks up and down the street, trying to determine if anyone might be close enough to notice her making the quick transition from her civilian clothing to her super heroine gear.

Seeing nobody around, Cathy quickly darts into the yard next to her, making her way over to a clump of bushes and rapidly ducking down into the middle of them. Sliding her backpack to the ground next to her, she stands up to her full height, and in doing so realizes that the bushes only come up to just above her round, full breasts, and that if she were to stand at her full height at the wrong time someone could spot her head and come investigate. 'Or see something else,' she thought, blushing to herself madly. 'Might as well get on with this' she thought 'before someone shows up or its too late.' Crouching down again, she grabs her full body, skin tight suit out of her backpack, and sets it down on a low hanging branch next to her.

Suddenly another scream rips through the air, spurring Cathy into action. Quickly, she pulls her shirt off of her head, exposing her bra and large breasts to the open air, the chill reminding her of her exposure. Pushing these thoughts away, Cathy kicked off her shoes and socks, and pulled her skirt down to the ground and off of her legs, leaving her wearing nothing more than a lacy blue bra and a black thong. 'Oh my god' she thought, 'if anyone were to see me right now I don't know what I would do.'

Cathy shivered again, before realizing that somebody needed her help, and spurring herself on with a 'you can do it girl!' thought, she unclasped her bra, sliding it down her arms and off her body, allowing it to fall to the ground. 1212.content:
Cathy threw her hands up over her face, leaving everything else exposed. She had to find clothes fast, or at least a mask. The crowds of people below were still screaming, but what had sounded like fear from a distance now seemed like cat calls and lame pick up lines. "These are the people I'm trying to save," she muttered. Meanwhile, the super villain changed the level of his gun and fired at her again, but instead of disintegrating clothes that she no longer had, it knocked her right out of the sky and into a building.

He laughed madly. "You can't fight me without risking your identity, girl, so I'm going to humiliate you until I get bored or you run away."

Looking around the rubble, Cathy realized that the building she had crashed into was a clothing outlet store. She grabbed a shirt, pulled it over her head, and tied it around like a mask. "Stop monologuing."

The super villain realized that the naked heroine was surrounded by clothes and fired his disintegration ray, but Cathy saw it coming and flew out of the way and went outside. She picked up a car to throw at him when a man on the street interrupted her.

"Wait, hold on! You can't take that car. That's my car." His eyes raked over her naked body. "Of course, with a body like that, I'm sure we can come to some...arrangement."

"Citizen, you just lost your car privileges." She flew up in the air with the car and shouted at the super villain. "Hey, pervert with the ray gun! You want to play? Let's play."

The super villain's eyes grew wide behind his mask. "Um, actually, if you want to stop playing, I'm fine with that."

"Too late." She threw the car at his head. She figured that if that didn't knock him out, nothing would.

Then, before the news reporters could get there, or anyone else with a camera, Cathy flew into the sky and headed home. If she flew all the way to her house, someone might discover her secret identity, so she had to land about a mile away and make the rest of the way on foot. She undid her mask and wore it like a shirt, wishing that she had picked a bigger one, and covered her crotch with her hands. Hopefully, no one who saw her would match the masked marvel with the half naked girl running down the street. Heck, chances were that no one who saw her would notice anything besides her exposed butt.

Some of her neighbors saw her, but they didn't do much besides wave and say hi because they were all used to seeing her come home in even less. When she got home, she opened up the door and saw her little brother, Randy, watching tv on the couch.

"Hey, Cathy," he said looking up at her and seeing that she wasn't wearing pants. "I was going to ask you how swim meet went, but it looks like you had even more fun."

Cathy glared at her fourteen year old brother. She hadn't forgotten about the swimsuit that Randy had gotten him that had dissolved in front of half the school. She would give anything to be able to throw a car at his head too, but she had to be careful because her family...
1212.title: Makeshift Mask

choices: Shower
Mission
12122.content:
Her whole family were super heroes. Cathy could fly and had super strength, Randy had super speed, Mom had telekinesis, and Dad could turn invisible. Mom always wanted them to fight crime together because it would help them become closer as a family, but sometimes they irritated Cathy to no end.

"So is there a reason you're half naked, or are you just having fun?" Randy asked.

Cathy fumed and grabbed a couch cushion to hold over her exposed crotch. "I ran into a super villain on the way home from school," she explained. "He had a ray gun that disintegrated clothes, so I lost my costume again."

"Really?" Randy asked, interested. "I could use a gun like that. What happened to it?"

"It got hit by a car."

"Huh. Well, if you lost your costume, let me order another one for you. This is so much easier now that your look's a Halloween item. You never know when you'll need it."

"Oh no," she said. "If I want another costume, I'll order it myself. You'd probably get me one that dissolves in sunlight or something."

Randy laughed. "Are you still upset about that? Take it easy, Cathy. It was a joke. You're probably the only person who didn't see the humor in it."

"Humor! Half the school saw me naked! Do you think that is funny?"

"Yeah."

"Why you little--I'll--" Cathy threw the nearest thing she had at his head. It turned out to be the couch cushion, leaving her exposed again. With her super strength, even a cushion could do some damage, but with Randy's super speed, he was behind her before it hit the wall.

"Nice shot." He spanked her bottom. "Nice view, too."

Cathy swung punch after punch at him, but he was so fast, the only thing that happened was that he literally stole the shirt off her back, leaving her completely naked in her family room.

"Hey! That's mine, you little twerp! Give it back!"

Randy waved the shirt around like he was a matador. "You want it? Come and get it." Cathy charged, but got nothing besides another spank. "Run, run, run as fast as you can, you can't catch me, I'm the Gingerbread Man."

"You won't run so fast after I break your legs," she snarled, charging again.

"You know, as much as I hate to enjoy dancing with my sister, you make this fun," Randy said. "I really should film this."

"You want to dance?" Cathy demanded, lifting up a couch over her head. "Fine. Let's dance!"

Suddenly the couch flew to the ceiling and Cathy and Randy flew to opposite walls. Their telepathic mother walked into the room with disappointment on her face. "How many times do I have to tell you two, no roughhousing!" she said. "If you're going to fight, take it outside." She looked at Cathy. "But you're not going anywhere dressed like that. Honestly, I know you're in the privacy of your own home, but we have windows. It simply isn't decent."

"He's the one who took my clothes!" she said, pointing accusingly at Randy.

"You're the one who threatened to break my legs!"

"Enough!" Mom shouted. "I don't want to hear about it. Both of you, go to your room, right now!"

"Yes, Mom," they chorused.

Cathy glared at Randy in the hallway. "Gremlin," she muttered.

"Troll."

Cathy slammed her bedroom door--accidentally. If she slammed it intentionally, there'd have been splinters--and threw herself on her bed. So far, it had been an incredibly rotten day. She wanted to boil herself in the shower, but on the other hand, she could check if her superhero organization had any missions for her. Slamming a criminal's head through a concrete wall could be just what she needed right now. Either way, the day couldn't get any worse.

12123.content:
Randy was the spitting image of a soulless ginger with pale skin, short red hair, and freckles. Unfortunately for Cathy, he was also an evil genius in miniature. Short, smug, and maniacal, he made it his solemn duty to make Cathy's life miserable.

And because their parents were super villains too, Cathy could hardly go to them for help. To them, Randy was their darling little honors student while Cathy was a rebellious teenager with a drug problem, her drug of choice being heroics. They loved her, of course, trying to take over the world didn't change that, but they made it clear that they wished that she could be a bit more evil.

Cathy tugged at the hem of her shirt. She could cover the important bits in front of she bent over slightly and stretched the shirt to its limits, but that exposed her butt completely, so she made sure to face her brother.

"Randy," she said coldly, "I am going to go up to my room, put some clothes on, and then do something horrible to you."

He laughed. "Like what? Turn me over to the proper authorities? Good luck with that."

She grit her teeth, but he had a point. There wasn't a lot she could do without losing her super hero status, and even less to a family member. Still, she'd think of something. She turned around, careful to cover her butt as soon as it came into view, and started to trudge off.

"By the way," Randy called after her. "News flash, you flashed the news."

She turned around before realizing that she was still covering her butt while exposing her front and facing him, giving him an eyeful. Which was a pointless thing to worry about, because she was completely naked on TV, wearing only a makeshift mask. She had been so focused on the man with the Nude-Ray, she hadn't noticed the local news station filming the whole thing. And because they cast the news live (and because Cathy couldn't sue them without exposing her secret identity), Cathy's super powered alter ego was displayed to the world naked and uncensored.

"No!" she moaned. Now everyone she knew, even the one's who wouldn't recognize her, had seen her naked. Whenever she put on her spandex super suit to fight evil, she'd be remembered as the super heroine who was filmed flying around naked. It was almost enough to give up vigilantism all together … but that was what her parents would want, and she wasn't going to give in.

Randy grinned. "I can't wait to see Mom and Dad's faces when they find out."

Cathy frowned. The Nude-Ray … that was the sort of thing that their father liked to invent. Other super villains built death rays and doomsday devices, but their father designed weapons for chaos and humiliation. "Dad didn't invent that, did he?" she asked.

Randy grinned and said …

"...well, at least I'm not bare-assed!"

Cathy looks down at her front. She still sees her cover at her boobs and her pussy.

"Well, I'm not bare-assed either!" she says, laughing.

"Look again!" the villain laughs back.

Cathy then looks behind and in a window, she can see her completely naked butt shine back at her as a mirror in the window. Only some tapes holds the skirt up at the front, but the back has disappeared completely, and forces her to fight with her bare ass on display.

"NO!" Cathy screams as she puts both her hands down at the back trying to cover her bare ass. She decides to....

123.content:
"Good morning beautiful!" said a man who was suddenly in front of her.

She yelped when she saw him, then yelped again and covered her breasts when she realized they were exposed. "D-do you mind? I'm changing."

"You're changing," he repeated. "In broad daylight, in the middle of a public street."

"Yes."

"Including your underwear."

"Would you turn around? I can't change with you watching me."

"I won't stop you," he said. "But I don't mind watching a job half done." He pulled out his phone. "Don't hold it against me if I film this."

Cathy's face turned red. She wanted to pass as a normal girl until she was in her super suit, but no girl would put up with this. She pulled her hand back and slapped him across the face, like a normal girl would. A normal girl's slap, however, probably would not have sent him flying across the street.

"Oh my gosh," she gasped. "I hope he isn't dead."

info.brief_description: Cathy is a superhero who can fly and is inhumanly strong, but her luck is ultra bad.
info.description:
Cathy's powers include only flight and strength.

She is accident prone in the most embarrassing way, so she isn't an exhibitionist; so stripping her naked, forcing her to keep her cover by sleeping with the enemy, getting called to help while in the shower are all effective against her. Try to keep it as embarrassing as possible.

She has a crush, Derrick, whom has slept with every girl in school except her (she is 16). She lost her virginity to a scumball she went undercover with when they were sure they were being watched and were supposed to be a married couple on their honeymoon.

You cannot kill Cathy.
